article: My grandparents lived in a town in Michigan .Every summer I stayed with them as a young child .I came from the city but loved the small _ they lived in. People knew everyone else,their kids,their pets and their ancestors. The bond with them _ to grow as I grew older. My grandma was _ at making something exciting by hand. She would make little sandwiches and we'd have tea parties. She'd _ flowers and carefully tend them. She'd _ sweaters for her grandchildren as well as making beautiful _ for each one. I remember the small thimble she would use while doing her needlework. . _ her thimble on her finger,she'd remark: "I wouldn't want to sew without one." A few years ago my grandma passed away at the age of 91.After attending her funeral,I realized how _ our lives had changed. I missed her very much. When my birthday came,I was feeling _ because there was no card from my grandma .But what happened later made me feel that she was _ that special day with me. While I was arranging some _ pillows that my grandma had made,I _ felt something inside one pillow .It was small and _ .I moved the object to a seam and I carefully opened it. To my _ ,out came a tiny silver thimble! How _ I was to find something that had been a part of her. Not realizing it had fallen off her finger,my grandma _ it in that little pillow for me. I carefully laid the thimble along with the other things I had _ over the years,which reminded me of the pleasant _ of her. I heated the tea kettle and made some _ ,using my best china,as my grandma always did,and enjoyed my tea and my grandma's thimble. What a wonderful birthday that was!
